00030   class SerializedKey : public ByteString {
00031   public:
00032     SerializedKey() {}
00033     SerializedKey(const uint8_t *buf) : ByteString(buf) { }
00034     SerializedKey(ByteString bs) { ptr = bs.ptr; }
00035 
00036     int compare(const SerializedKey sk) const {
00037       const uint8_t *ptr1, *ptr2;
00038       int len1 = decode_length(&ptr1);
00039       int len2 = sk.decode_length(&ptr2);
00040 
00041       // common case
00042       if (*ptr1 != *ptr2) {
00043         if ( *ptr1 == 0xD0 ) // see Key.h
00044           len2 -= 8;
00045         else if ( *ptr2 == 0xD0 ) // see Key.h
00046           len1 -= 8;
00047         else {
00048           len1 -= 8;
00049           len2 -= 8;
00050         }
00051       }
00052       int len = (len1 < len2) ? len1 : len2;
00053       int cmp = memcmp(ptr1+1, ptr2+1, len-1);
00054       return (cmp==0) ? len1 - len2 : cmp;
00055     }
00056 
00057     const char *row() const {
00058       const uint8_t *rptr = ptr;
00059       Serialization::decode_vi32(&rptr);
00060       return (const char *)rptr+1;
00061     }
00062   };
00063 
00064   inline bool operator==(const SerializedKey sk1, const SerializedKey sk2) {
00065     return sk1.compare(sk2) == 0;
00066   }
00067 
00068   inline bool operator!=(const SerializedKey sk1, const SerializedKey sk2) {
00069     return sk1.compare(sk2) != 0;
00070   }
00071 
00072   inline bool operator<(const SerializedKey sk1, const SerializedKey sk2) {
00073     return sk1.compare(sk2) < 0;
00074   }
00075 
00076   inline bool operator<=(const SerializedKey sk1, const SerializedKey sk2) {
00077     return sk1.compare(sk2) <= 0;
00078   }
00079 
00080   inline bool operator>(const SerializedKey sk1, const SerializedKey sk2) {
00081     return sk1.compare(sk2) > 0;
00082   }
00083 
00084   inline bool operator>=(const SerializedKey sk1, const SerializedKey sk2) {
00085     return sk1.compare(sk2) >= 0;
00086   }
